title: Treasury says it has 'paused production' of Brexit 50p coins because of missed Oct 31 deadline
text:
Sajid Javid has "paused" production of the new Brexit 50p coins due to the likelihood that the UK will not leave the European Union next Thursday.

The Chancellor unveiled plans to mint 10 million Brexit 50p coins - three times more than previously planned last month.

Three million coins - imprinted with the Brexit date of 31 October - were planned to be ready to spend by the end of the month.

A further seven million coins would have been struck in the first year. The plans were approved by the Queen earlier this month.

However a Treasury source told The Daily Telegraph: "We have paused production of the Brexit coin and will take a final decision in due course."

The Treasury declined to comment...
description: Sajid Javid has "paused" production of the new Brexit 50p coins due to the likelihood that the UK will not leave the European Union next Thursday.
